item.title: 美国法院搁置金德摩根公司在田纳西州修建输油管道的许可
item.description: 在环保组织的敦促下，美国一家上诉法院周五搁置了允许康德摩根子公司在田纳西州修建一条 32 英里天然气管道所需的审批和许可。【原文：A U.S. appeals court on Friday put on hold approvals and permits necessary to allow a Kinder Morgan subsidiary to construct a 32-mile gas pipeline in Tennessee, at the urging of environmental groups.】

item.title: 汽车技术支持协议达成后，菲斯科破产计划获批
item.description: 电动汽车初创公司菲斯科周五获得了法院对其破产清算计划的批准，在此之前，该公司在最后一刻通过谈判，以4600万美元的价格出售了约3000辆遨享SUV的剩余库存。【原文：Electric vehicle startup Fisker received court approval of its bankruptcy liquidation plan on Friday, following last-minute negotiations to preserve the company's $46 million sale of its remaining inventory of about 3,000 Ocean SUVs.】

item.title: 埃隆-马斯克的 X 公司将联合利华从广告商抵制诉讼中剔除
item.description: 埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的 X 公司周五将联合利华（Unilever）从一桩诉讼案中剔除，该诉讼案称这家消费品巨头和其他公司与一个广告行业组织合谋抵制该社交媒体平台，导致其收入损失。【原文：Elon Musk’s X on Friday dropped Unilever from a lawsuit that claimed the consumer goods giant and others conspired with an advertising industry group to boycott the social media platform, causing it to lose revenue.】

item.title: 罢工影响财务状况，波音将裁员 1.7 万人并推迟首批 777X 的交付
item.description: 美国飞机制造商波音公司（Boeing）首席执行官凯利-奥特伯格（Kelly Ortberg）周五表示，由于长达一个月的罢工对公司财务造成严重影响，波音公司将裁员1.7万人，占全球员工总数的10%，并将777X喷气式飞机的首次交付时间推迟一年，同时宣布国防业务将出现大量新的亏损。【原文：U.S. planemaker Boeing will cut 17,000 jobs, or 10% of its global workforce, delay first delivery of its 777X jet by a year and announced substantial new losses in its defense business as a month-long strike batters company finances, CEO Kelly Ortberg said on Friday.】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织（IMF）将把成员国借款成本每年降低 12 亿美元
item.description: 国际货币基金组织总裁克里斯塔琳娜-格奥尔基耶娃（Kristalina Georgieva）表示，该组织周五批准了一些措施，每年将其成员国的借贷成本降低约 12 亿美元。【原文：The International Monetary Fund on Friday approved measures to reduce its members' borrowing costs by about $1.2 billion annually, the fund's Managing Director Kristalina Georgieva said.】

item.title: 经济向好，美国信贷息差收窄至新低
item.description: 最近几天，美国企业信贷息差创下多年新低，表明投资者信心不断增强，但一些市场人士担心，鉴于未来的经济风险，企业债务投资者可能过于乐观。【原文：U.S. corporate credit spreads hit fresh multi-year lows in recent days in a sign of growing investor confidence, although some market participants worry corporate debt investors may be too optimistic given economic risks ahead.】

item.title: 独家报道CVS 将退出核心输液服务业务，可能裁员
item.description: CVS Health 公司发言人周五向路透社证实，该公司正在退出其核心输液服务业务，并计划在未来几个月内关闭或出售 29 家相关地区药店。【原文：CVS Health is exiting its core infusion services business and plans to either close or sell 29 related regional pharmacies in the coming months, a company spokesperson confirmed to Reuters on Friday.】

item.title: 华尔街一周前瞻 财报季升温，美国消费者健康状况受关注
item.description: 下周，美国消费者的健康状况将成为焦点，投资者将关注企业盈利报告和零售销售数据，以进一步确认本月提振股市的经济韧性。【原文：The health of the U.S. consumer moves into the spotlight next week, with investors watching corporate earnings reports and retail sales data for further confirmation of the economic resilience that has boosted equity markets this month.】

item.title: 英国航空公司因罗尔斯-罗伊斯公司零部件延误而更改航班时刻表
item.description: 英国航空公司（British Airways）周五表示，由于罗尔斯-罗伊斯公司（Rolls-Royce）的发动机和零部件交货延迟，特别是其 787 飞机上安装的遄达 1000 型发动机交货延迟，该公司已对其航班计划做出额外调整。【原文：British Airways said on Friday it has made additional changes to its schedule due to delays in the delivery of engines and parts from Rolls-Royce , particularly the Trent 1000 engines fitted to its 787 aircraft.】

item.title: 苹果公司被美国劳工委员会指控限制员工使用 Slack 和社交媒体
item.description: 美国国家劳工关系委员会周五表示，苹果公司被美国劳工委员会指控限制工人使用社交媒体和工作场所消息应用程序 Slack，从而干涉了工人集体争取更好工作条件的权利。【原文：Apple has been accused by a U.S. labor board of interfering with workers' rights to collectively advocate for better working conditions by restricting their use of social media and workplace messaging app Slack, the National Labor Relations Board said on Friday.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，Odyssey 正在就收购霍尼韦尔面罩部门进行深入谈判
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周五援引知情人士的话报道，私募股权公司 Odyssey 正在就收购霍尼韦尔面罩部门进行深入谈判。【原文：Private equity firm Odyssey is in advanced negotiations to buy Honeywell's face mask unit, Bloomberg News reported on Friday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 美国大型银行称，尽管经济令人担忧，但消费者依然强劲
item.description: 美国最大的两家贷款机构周五表示，尽管有迹象表明通胀率上升使一些收入较低的美国人捉襟见肘，但美国消费者在第三季度仍保持了强劲的消费势头。【原文：U.S. consumers remain resilient with solid spending in the third quarter, two of the country's biggest lenders said on Friday, although there are signs higher inflation has stretched some Americans on lower incomes.】

item.title: 美国议员要求电信公司就中国黑客攻击报告做出答复
item.description: 据报道，中国黑客入侵了美国宽带服务提供商的网络，一个由美国两党议员组成的小组周五要求 AT&T 、Verizon Communications 和 Lumen Technologies 回答相关问题。【原文：A bipartisan group of U.S. lawmakers asked AT&T , Verizon Communications , and Lumen Technologies on Friday to answer questions after a report Chinese hackers accessed the networks of U.S. broadband providers.】

item.title: 埃尼集团首席执行官称美国基金对集团战略充满信心
item.description: 意大利能源集团首席执行官克劳迪奥-德斯卡尔齐（Claudio Descalzi）周五表示，美国投资基金对埃尼分拆成长型业务以吸引资金的战略充满信心。【原文：U.S. investment funds are showing confidence in Eni's strategy of spinning off growth businesses in order to attract financial resources, the Italian energy group's CEO Claudio Descalzi said on Friday.】

item.title: 美国监督机构批评联邦航空局对波音生产的监督
item.description: 周五，一个联邦监督机构批评了联邦航空管理局对波音飞机生产的监督，称其没有一个有效的系统来监督这家飞机制造商的各个生产设施。【原文：A federal watchdog on Friday criticized the Federal Aviation Administration's oversight of Boeing airplane production, saying it does not have an effective system to oversee the planemaker's individual manufacturing facilities.】

item.title: 美国财政部呼吁国际货币基金组织和世界银行就流动性压力采取新措施
item.description: 美国财政部最高经济外交官周五呼吁国际货币基金组织和多边开发银行研究新的方法，为中低收入国家提供短期流动性支持，以避免债务危机。【原文：The U.S. Treasury's top economic diplomat on Friday called on the International Monetary Fund and multilateral development banks to work on new ways to provide short-term liquidity support to low- and middle-income countries to head off debt crises.】

item.title: 美国 10 月份消费者信心指数下滑
item.description: 周五的一项调查显示，由于对高物价的不满情绪挥之不去，10月份美国消费者情绪下滑。【原文：U.S. consumer sentiment slipped in October amid lingering frustration over high prices, a survey showed on Friday.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称日本三井物产准备重返贵金属交易领域
item.description: 三位知情人士告诉路透社，日本三井物产公司（Mitsui & Co）计划在阔别九年后重新进入全球贵金属交易，以对冲客户风险。【原文：Japan's Mitsui & Co plans to re-enter global precious metals trading to hedge client risk after a nine-year absence, three sources with knowledge of the matter told Reuters.】

item.title: 波音公司动荡之年的五张图表
item.description: 波音公司全年都深陷危机之中。【原文：Boeing has been mired in crisis all year.】

item.title: 科幻烟雾弥漫：投资者和专家对特斯拉推出机器人出租车的反应
item.description: 特斯拉周四展示了期待已久的机器人出租车，它有两个鸥翼车门，没有方向盘或踏板，但这场华丽的活动细节不多，令希望获得更多具体计划的投资者大失所望。【原文：Tesla on Thursday showcased its long-awaited robotaxi with two gull-wing doors and no steering wheel or pedals, but the glitzy event was light on detail, disappointing investors who had hoped for more concrete plans.】

item.title: 独家消息消息人士称德国正努力挫败联合信贷银行对德国商业银行的竞购
item.description: 几位熟悉德国政府和监管机构想法的人士告诉路透社记者，德国正在努力阻止意大利竞争对手可能收购德国最大的银行之一，这一立场将柏林与罗马和欧洲监管机构对立起来。【原文：Germany is working to frustrate a possible takeover of one of its biggest banks by an Italian rival, a stance that pits Berlin against Rome and Europe's regulators, several people familiar with government and regulators' thinking told Reuters.】

item.title: 卢拉抨击美国要求提供巴西购买战斗机的信息
item.description: 巴西总统路易斯-伊纳西奥-卢拉-达席尔瓦（Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva）周五表示，美国司法部要求萨博公司提供有关巴西于2014年购买瑞典鹰狮战斗机的信息是 "毫无意义的"。【原文：Brazilian President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva said on Friday it made "no sense" for the U.S. Department of Justice to request information from Saab over Brazil's purchase of the Swedish firm's Gripen fighter jets in 2014.】

item.title: 降息观点导致美国股票基金资金外流
item.description: 截至 10 月 9 日的一周内，由于市场对美联储降息路径的预期发生变化以及债券收益率飙升，投资者纷纷获利了结，美国股票基金出现资金外流。【原文：U.S. equity funds witnessed outflows in the week to Oct. 9 as investors booked profits due to a shift in market expectations about the Federal Reserve rate cut path and a surge in bond yields.】

item.title: 交易员继续押注美联储 11 月和 12 月降息 25 个基点
item.description: 周五，一份报告显示，上个月的生产者价格与上个月相比没有变化，这表明通胀继续朝着美联储的目标迈进，因此在即将召开的美联储政策会议上将美国利率下调四分之一个百分点的理由似乎不攻自破。【原文：The case for quarter-point U.S. interest-rate cuts at upcoming Federal Reserve policy meetings appeared intact on Friday after a report showed producer prices were unchanged last month compared to the prior month, suggesting inflation continues on track toward the Federal Reserve's target.】

item.title: 因经营疲软，穆迪将大众汽车前景展望下调至 "负面
item.description: 评级机构穆迪（Moody's）将大众汽车的评级展望从 "稳定 "下调至 "负面"，理由是欧洲第一大汽车制造商的经营业绩不断恶化，预计扭转局面将面临挑战。【原文：Rating agency Moody's has cut its outlook on Volkswagen to "negative" from "stable", citing a deteriorating operating performance at Europe's top carmaker and expected challenges to turn the situation around.】

item.title: 美国 9 月份生产者价格保持不变
item.description: 美国生产者价格在 9 月份保持不变，表明通胀前景依然有利，并支持了美联储将在下个月再次降息的观点。【原文：U.S. producer prices were unchanged in September, pointing to a still-favorable inflation outlook and supporting views that the Federal Reserve would cut interest rates again next month.】

item.title: 由于安全产品需求旺盛，Fastenal 季度利润略超预期
item.description: 受益于对安全产品的持续需求，工业用品制造商法斯顿（Fastenal）周五公布的第三季度利润略高于分析师的预期。【原文：Industrial supplies maker Fastenal on Friday posted a third-quarter profit that marginally surpassed analysts' estimates, benefiting from a sustained demand for its safety products.】

item.title: 瑞典法院维持对特斯拉劳资纠纷的裁决
item.description: 瑞典一家地方法院周五维持了一项初步裁决，即瑞典邮政服务公司 Postnord 无需向特斯拉交付车牌，而特斯拉的车牌正受到邮政工人的阻挠，这也是更广泛的工会同情罢工的一部分。【原文：A Swedish district court on Friday upheld a preliminary ruling that Sweden's postal service Postnord does not need to deliver licence plates to Tesla , which are being blocked by the postal workers as part of a wider labour union sympathy strike.】

item.title: 全球货币市场基金连续第三周吸引资金流入
item.description: 截至 10 月 9 日的一周内，受美联储降息预期减弱和对中东冲突保持谨慎的影响，全球投资者对货币市场基金进行了大量投资。【原文：Global investors made large investments in money market funds in the week to Oct. 9 driven by a push back in Federal Reserve rate cut expectations and caution over the Middle East conflict.】

item.title: 尽管需求放缓，电动汽车公司 Polestar 预计第四季度毛利率仍将保持正增长
item.description: Polestar 上周五表示，尽管第三季度电动汽车的交付量下降了 14%，但预计第四季度将实现正毛利率。【原文：Polestar said on Friday that it expected to achieve a positive gross profit margin in the fourth quarter despite its electric vehicle deliveries falling 14% in the third quarter.】
